arts.ttl: Official: AC Milan vs. Lecce starting XIs – six changes from Udinese win
arts.sum: By: Oliver Fisher AC Milan will play their sixth competitive game of 2025-26 tonight, and it will already be their second of the campaign against Lecce. Milan got the better of Lecce in the league, with Ruben Loftus-Cheek and Christian Pulisic scoring in a 2-0 victory late last month. arts.ttl: The five key battles that could win or lose the game for Milan against Lecce
arts.sum: By: Oliver Fisher AC Milan welcome Lecce to San Siro in the Coppa Italia round of 32, in what is the second meeting between the teams already in 2025-26. A few weeks ago, Milan celebrated a 2-0 win at the Stadio Via del Mare. They were made to wait until the second half to break the deadlock, but […] The post The five key battles that could win or lose the game for Milan against Lecce appeared first on SempreMilan.

arts.ttl: GdS: Prudence prevails – why Allegri will start Terracciano over Maignan against Lecce
arts.sum: By: Oliver Fisher Massimiliano Allegri does not intend to take any risks with Mike Maignan and will therefore not use him against Lecce tonight. La Gazzetta dello Sport report that unlike Leao’s calf – which initially seemed minor but turned out to be a more serious issue – Maignan’s doesn’t appear likely to require excessive treatment. It was […] The post GdS: Prudence prevails – why Allegri will start Terracciano over Maignan against Lecce appeared first on SempreMilan.

arts.ttl: Coppa Italia clash vs Lecce crucial for Milan’s Ricci to convince Italy coach Gattuso
arts.sum: A night as the maestro in place of the maestro. Samuele Ricci has a chance to start tonight against Lecce in the Coppa Italia round of 16. Luka Modric will rest, and the former Torino midfielder will lead the midfield with his playmaking. Samuele Ricci’s first mission: win over Allegri Tuttosport writes today: “For Ricci, […]
